headline: Deportation Officer at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
summary:
My goal has always been to be the best at what I do whether it's in immigration, research projects at school or competing nationwide in martial arts.
    My diverse experience has allowed me to develop a wide variety of skills. A marketing degree has taught me interpersonal skills, research abilities and persuasion which has helped me in law enforcement.
     Working as a federal agent, i have been to sent to work in Las Cruces, and Eloy, Arizona. I work closely with Donna Ana Correctional facility to interview possible aliens and write up cases against them. I worked with fugitive operations which included searching for absconders.
    As a martial instructor, I worked closely with minors. I learned how to adapt my teaching style to different personality types.

positions.description: I work for the Fugitive Operations Team. I work doing investigations to build cases and find people that have absconded from the result of their immigration proceedings.
positions.title: Immigration Enforcement Agent

positions.description:
My job was basically to run the karate school or dojo at least once a week. I taught kids and adults of ages between 4-45.
   I had to find ways to challenge their mind, body and spirit. I lead them through exercise and self defense techniques. My responsibility was also to sell our school. We constantly had visitors inquiring. I was in charge to help coordinate events associated with the school
positions.title: Assistant Instructor
